title: Race condition in claiming program credentials

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

**Summary:**
I was invited to a private program and I tried to get test credentials so a request as follows was sent to your server:

```
POST /graphql HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
Connection: close
Content-Length: 778
Accept: */*
X-Auth-Token: ████
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/71.0.3578.98 Safari/537.36
Origin: https://hackerone.com
Content-Type: application/json
Referer: https://hackerone.com/█████
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9,he;q=0.8
Cookie: __cfduid=███████; _cfuid=███████; _ga=████; _mkto_trk=id:████████

{"query":"mutation Claim_credential_mutation($input_0:ClaimCredentialInput!,$types_1:[ErrorTypeEnum]!,$first_2:Int!) {claimCredential(input:$input_0) {clientMutationId,...F4,...F5}} fragment F0 on Team {id,claimed_credential {credentials,account_details,id}} fragment F1 on Node {id} fragment F2 on ResourceInterface {...F0,...F1} fragment F3 on Team {id} fragment F4 on ClaimCredentialPayload {team {id,...F2,...F3}} fragment F5 on ClaimCredentialPayload {team {claimed_credential {id},id},was_successful,_errors4fkckF:errors(types:$types_1,first:$first_2) {edges {node {type,field,message,id},cursor},pageInfo {hasNextPage,hasPreviousPage}}}","variables":{"input_0":{"team_id":"█████=","clientMutationId":"1"},"types_1":"ARGUMENT","first_2":100}}
```

and I then sent this request to burp suite intruder and got 22 responses , 21 of them had the same response as this:

```
{"data":{"claimCredential":{"clientMutationId":"1","team":{"claimed_credential":{"id":"██████████","credentials":{"email":"██████","password":"███████","private_id":"██████"},"account_details":null},"id":"██████="},"was_successful":false,"_errors4fkckF":{"edges":[],"pageInfo":{"hasNextPage":false,"hasPreviousPage":false}}}}}
```

and the last one was holding a different set of credentials as this:

```
{"data":{"claimCredential":{"clientMutationId":"1","team":{"claimed_credential":{"id":"███████","credentials":{"email":"████████","password":"███████","private_id":"███"},"account_details":null},"id":"██████████="},"was_successful":true,"_errors4fkckF":{"edges":[],"pageInfo":{"hasNextPage":false,"hasPreviousPage":false}}}}}
```

in this case I was able to have multiple test credentials and maybe block another user from getting a test account if the program provided a limited amount of test accounts.


thanks!

## Impact

claiming multiple credentials for the same user
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

Summary:
I was invited to a private program and I tried to get test credentials so a request as follows was sent to your server:

POST /graphql HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
Connection: close
Content-Length: 778
Accept: */*
X-Auth-Token: ████
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/71.0.3578.98 Safari/537.36
Origin: https://hackerone.com
Content-Type: application/json
Referer: https://hackerone.com/█████
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9,he;q=0.8
Cookie: __cfduid=███████; _cfuid=███████; _ga=████; _mkto_trk=id:████████

{"query":"mutation Claim_credential_mutation($input_0:ClaimCredentialInput!,$types_1:[ErrorTypeEnum]!,$first_2:Int!) {claimCredential(input:$input_0) {clientMutationId,...F4,...F5}} fragment F0 on Team {id,claimed_credential {credentials,account_details,id}} fragment F1 on Node {id} fragment F2 on ResourceInterface {...F0,...F1} fragment F3 on Team {id} fragment F4 on ClaimCredentialPayload {team {id,...F2,...F3}} fragment F5 on ClaimCredentialPayload {team {claimed_credential {id},id},was_successful,_errors4fkckF:errors(types:$types_1,first:$first_2) {edges {node {type,field,message,id},cursor},pageInfo {hasNextPage,hasPreviousPage}}}","variables":{"input_0":{"team_id":"█████=","clientMutationId":"1"},"types_1":"ARGUMENT","first_2":100}}

and I then sent this request to burp suite intruder and got 22 responses , 21 of them had the same response as this:

{"data":{"claimCredential":{"clientMutationId":"1","team":{"claimed_credential":{"id":"██████████","credentials":{"email":"██████","password":"███████","private_id":"██████"},"account_details":null},"id":"██████="},"was_successful":false,"_errors4fkckF":{"edges":[],"pageInfo":{"hasNextPage":false,"hasPreviousPage":false}}}}}

and the last one was holding a different set of credentials as this:

{"data":{"claimCredential":{"clientMutationId":"1","team":{"claimed_credential":{"id":"███████","credentials":{"email":"████████","password":"███████","private_id":"███"},"account_details":null},"id":"██████████="},"was_successful":true,"_errors4fkckF":{"edges":[],"pageInfo":{"hasNextPage":false,"hasPreviousPage":false}}}}}

in this case I was able to have multiple test credentials and maybe block another user from getting a test account if the program provided a limited amount of test accounts.

thanks!

Impact

claiming multiple credentials for the same user

activities.message: here is the first credentials id `gid://hackerone/Credential/███` and this is for the second claimed `gid://hackerone/Credential/██████████`

activities.message: @security  can you kindly look into this?
activities.markdown_message: @security can you kindly look into this?

activities.message: @security @jobert anyone would at least say something here? , it has been `6` days without any response!
activities.markdown_message: @security @jobert anyone would at least say something here? , it has been 6 days without any response!

activities.message: Hey @flashdisk - Thank you for your submission and sorry for the delayed response. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.
activities.markdown_message: Hey @flashdisk - Thank you for your submission and sorry for the delayed response. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

activities.message: @security  @tuxedo giving a "fast" reply that the issue is reviewed by a Hackerone triage team isn't the best attitude here! , I can verify this issue myself in under `16` minutes and not `16` hours!
activities.markdown_message: @security @tuxedo giving a "fast" reply that the issue is reviewed by a Hackerone triage team isn't the best attitude here! , I can verify this issue myself in under 16 minutes and not 16 hours!

activities.message: Hi @flashdisk - that's totally on me, not on any of the triage members. We were working on some other tickets before we could get to yours. Thanks for your understanding.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @flashdisk - that's totally on me, not on any of the triage members. We were working on some other tickets before we could get to yours. Thanks for your understanding.

activities.message: Hi @flashdisk - thanks again for your report. We were able to reproduce the behavior you describe. We'll prioritize a fix and keep you posted throughout the process. Happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @flashdisk - thanks again for your report. We were able to reproduce the behavior you describe. We'll prioritize a fix and keep you posted throughout the process. Happy hacking!

activities.message: Hi @jobert  can you kindly check if also the endpoint which exists in https://hackerone.com/settings/vpn and generates the user Hackerone VPN settings is not also vulnerable to this type of attack? thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @jobert can you kindly check if also the endpoint which exists in https://hackerone.com/settings/vpn and generates the user Hackerone VPN settings is not also vulnerable to this type of attack? thanks!

activities.message: @pei  @security  @jobert please reply to my last comment!, thanks!
activities.markdown_message: @pei @security @jobert please reply to my last comment!, thanks!

activities.message:
Hey @flashdisk,

My team has reported that the VPN endpoint is not exploitable at this point in time. Also, we've released a fix for the race condition. Is it possible for you to confirm?

Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @flashdisk,

My team has reported that the VPN endpoint is not exploitable at this point in time. Also, we've released a fix for the race condition. Is it possible for you to confirm?

Thanks!

activities.message: Hi @bencode , much appreciated for checking the other endpoint , to confirm the fix I need new program with credintials feature enabled and I didn’t generate a request for getting the credentials, so I can’t really confirm this for now!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @bencode , much appreciated for checking the other endpoint , to confirm the fix I need new program with credintials feature enabled and I didn’t generate a request for getting the credentials, so I can’t really confirm this for now!

activities.message:
Hi @flashdisk -

We've revoked your credential `██████` that you used to demonstrate this vulnerability. This means both of your credentials with program `█████████` have been revoked. Would you be able to claim another and verify our fix? Thanks! 

-Pei
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @flashdisk -

We've revoked your credential ██████ that you used to demonstrate this vulnerability. This means both of your credentials with program █████████ have been revoked. Would you be able to claim another and verify our fix? Thanks!

-Pei

activities.message: Hi @pei I will check it later and notify you, thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @pei I will check it later and notify you, thanks!

activities.message: @pei it seems to be fixed! , thanks!
activities.markdown_message: @pei it seems to be fixed! , thanks!
